content: tree options usage: tree [-acdfghilnpqrstuvxACDFJQNSUX] [-L level [-R]] [-HÂ baseHREF] [-T title] [-o filename] [-P pattern] [-I pattern] [--gitignore] [--gitfile[=]file] [--matchdirs] [--metafirst] [--ignore-case] [--nolinks] [--hintro[=]file] [--houtro[=]file] [--inodes] [--device] [--sort[=]<name>] [--dirsfirst] [--filesfirst] [--filelimit #] [--si] [--du] [--prune] [--charset[=]X] [--timefmt[=]format] [--fromfile] [--fflinks] [--info] [--infofile[=]file] [--noreport] [--version] [--help] [--] [directory ...] ------- Listing options ------- -aÂ All files are listed. -dÂ List directories only. -lÂ Follow symbolic links like directories. -fÂ Print the full path prefix for each file. -xÂ Stay on current filesystem only. -L levelÂ Descend only level directories deep. -RÂ Rerun tree when max dir level reached. -P patternÂ List only those files that match the pattern given. -I patternÂ Do not list files that match the given pattern. --gitignore Filter by using .gitignore files. --gitfile X Explicitly read gitignore file. --ignore-case Ignore case when pattern matching. --matchdirs Include directory names in -P pattern matching. --metafirst Print meta-data at the beginning of each line. --prune Prune empty directories from the output. --infoÂ Print information about files found in .info files. --infofile XÂ Explicitly read info file. --noreportÂ Turn off file/directory count at end of tree listing. --charset X Use charset X for terminal/HTML and indentation line output. --filelimit # Do not descend dirs with more than # files in them. -o filename Output to file instead of stdout. ------- File options ------- -qÂ Print non-printable characters as '?'. -NÂ Print non-printable characters as is. -QÂ Quote filenames with double quotes. -pÂ Print the protections for each file. -uÂ Displays file owner or UID number. -gÂ Displays file group owner or GID number. -sÂ Print the size in bytes of each file. -hÂ Print the size in a more human readable way. --siÂ Like -h, but use in SI units (powers of 1000). --duÂ Compute size of directories by their contents. -DÂ Print the date of last modification or (-c) status change. --timefmt <f> Print and format time according to the format <f>. -FÂ Appends '/', '=', '*', '@', '|' or '>' as per ls -F. --inodesÂ Print inode number of each file. --deviceÂ Print device ID number to which each file belongs. ------- Sorting options ------- -vÂ Sort files alphanumerically by version. -tÂ Sort files by last modification time. -cÂ Sort files by last status change time. -UÂ Leave files unsorted. -rÂ Reverse the order of the sort. --dirsfirst List directories before files (-U disables). --filesfirstÂ List files before directories (-U disables). --sort XÂ Select sort: name,version,size,mtime,ctime. ------- Graphics options ------- -iÂ Do not print indentation lines. -AÂ Print ANSI lines graphic indentation lines. -SÂ Print with CP437 (console) graphics indentation lines. -nÂ Turn colorization off always (-C overrides). -CÂ Turn colorization on always. ------- XML/HTML/JSON options ------- -XÂ Prints out an XML representation of the tree. -JÂ Prints out an JSON representation of the tree. -H baseHREF Prints out HTML format with baseHREF as top directory. -T string Replace the default HTML title and H1 header with string. --nolinks Turn off hyperlinks in HTML output. --hintro XÂ Use file X as the HTML intro. --houtro XÂ Use file X as the HTML outro. ------- Input options ------- --fromfileÂ Reads paths from files (.=stdin) --fflinks Process link informtion when using --fromfile. ------- Miscellaneous options ------- --version Print version and exit. --helpÂ Print usage and this help message and exit. --Â Options processing terminator.
